lead_paragraph: The Buick Invitational will have the top two players in the world after all. After three days of bed rest and antibiotics for respiratory problems, Phil Mickelson said Tuesday he was feeling better and will play in the pro-am Wednesday at the Buick Invitational, paving the way for him to make his 2008 debut at Torrey Pines. He also has a practice session planned with his swing coach, Butch Harmon.
